definitions.definition: raise to a higher position or level.
examples: he lifted his trophy over his head
synonyms: lever up; informalhump; literaryupheave "lift the pack onto your back"

definitions.definition: move (one's eyes or face) to face upward and look at someone or something.
examples: he lifted his eyes from the paper for an instant

definitions.definition: increase the volume or pitch of (one's voice).
examples: Willie sang boldly, lifting up his voice
higher than expected oil prices lifted Oklahoma's revenue
a helicopter lifted 11 crew members to safety from the ship

definitions.definition: hit or kick (a ball) high into the air.
(of a cloud, fog, etc.) move upward or away.
examples: the factory smoke hung low, never lifted

definitions.definition: perform cosmetic surgery on (especially the face or breasts) to reduce sagging.
examples: surgeons lift and remove excess skin from the face and neck

definitions.definition: pick up and move to a different position.
examples: he lifted her down from the pony's back

definitions.definition: enable (someone or something) to escape from an unpleasant situation.
examples: two billion barrels of oil that could lift this nation out of chronic poverty

definitions.definition: raise (a person's spirits or confidence); encourage or cheer.
examples: we heard inspiring talks that lifted our spirits
synonyms: revive; informalbuck up "the news lifted his spirits"

examples: suddenly his heart lifted, and he could have wept with relief

definitions.definition: formally remove or end (a legal restriction, decision, or ban).
examples: the European Community lifted its oil embargo against South Africa

definitions.definition: steal (something, especially a minor item of property).
examples: the shirt she had lifted from a supermarket

definitions.definition: use (a person's work or ideas) without permission or acknowledgment; plagiarize.
examples: this is a hackneyed adventure lifted straight from a vintage Lassie episode
synonyms: pinch "he lifted sections from a 1986 article"
